instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00244: What is 820-00244? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Macbook 12" keyboard issue
threads.message:
Hi

I have this Macbook 12" with keyboard problem. keyboard was sticky not always. some time it wouldn't worked. i thought the keyboard would be the issue but new keyboard also does the same thing even with new track pad. i have done SMC reset and PRAM reset. i have no idea what is this weird issue. could you please shed some light on this problem? what else do i need to do?
 Thanks

threads.title: Macbook 12" keyboard issue
threads.message:
Sorry i forgot to mention this 
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00244</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-08 is the board number

threads.title: Macbook 12" keyboard issue
threads.message:
All the keys non-working?
Trackpad works correctly?
Check them before and after logged into macOS; try to access boot menu.

threads.title: Macbook 12" keyboard issue
threads.message: keys works but some time sticky. if i press one key other multiple keys get pressed. some time works fine and another time keep pressing automatically.even before logged in and in boot menu also. i have tried by changing keyboard and track pad both but still same issue.
